intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris faucialis, commonly known as the common weed or shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring lobed leaves and small, white or pink flowers. The plant produces distinctive triangular or heart-shaped seed pods that split open when mature, dispersing its seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, roadsides, and agricultural fields. Its botanical features make it a common weed with ecological and historical significance.
